subclassFeature.name: Thief
entries: You hone your skills in the larcenous arts. Burglars, bandits, cutpurses, and other criminals typically follow this archetype, but so do rogues who prefer to think of themselves as professional treasure seekers, explorers, delvers, and investigators. In addition to improving your agility and stealth, you learn skills useful for delving into ancient ruins, reading unfamiliar languages, and using magic items you normally couldn't employ.

subclassFeature.name: Fast Hands
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you gain the ability to use the bonus action granted by your cunning action to make a Dexterity {@skill Sleight of Hand} check to use your Thieve's tools, deactivate a trap, try to open a lock, or the {@action Use an Object} action.

Aditionally, you gain proficiency with improvised weapons, and if such object (Alchemist's Fire, Ball bearings, Caltrops, Hunting Trap, etc.) has an already set saving throw, you can choose between that DC or the following formula:

subclassFeature.name: Second-Story Work
entries: Also at 3rd level, you gain climbing and swimming speed equal to your walking speed. Furthermore, your running jump now adds your dexterity modifier to the distance and falling from 15 ft or less won't make you fall {@condition Prone} or recieve fall damage.
Lastly, trying to Roll across a hostile creature will only cost you 5 ft, and passing through your allies won't cost you any extra movement.

subclassFeature.name: Supreme Sneak
entries: When you reach 9th level in this sub-class, you gain a single expertise in a skill you are already proficient. Aditionally, you gain advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks if you move no more than half your speed on the same turn.

subclassFeature.name: Finder Keepers
entries: Your cunning and greed have led you to be extremely skilled at using, understanding and improvising the operation of any type of equipment that you have managed to get your hands on. From this level onwards, ignore all race, level, class requirements, strength and proficiency over the use of magical and mundane items (Excluding tools).
Additionally, you can activate magic items with your Fast Hands trait, but you cannot replace the magic item DC.

subclassFeature.name: Unmatched Dexterity
entries: From this level onwards you get a second bonus action.
